page.title: 06COMMUNICATIONS:BDNGM/DNGTN
page.content: The post is brought from the post town at Woodbridge to Framlingham where it is sorted & distributed by van. There are 2 collections daily & one morning delivery plus an afternoon delivery for houses along the collection route. The area has 2 sub post offices, one in the general stores, Badingham & the other next to Dennington School. There are 6 post boxes. The telephone exchange in Low Street, Badingham serves the area & parts of neighbouring villages. Badingham has one public call box in Low Street & Dennington has 2 call boxes, one by the post office & another at Owls Green. 86% of households in Badingham & 73% in Dennington have a phone (average 79%). Of those without a phone only 2 in Badingham & 1 in Dennington felt unable to reach a phone in an emergency.
